title: Variables and Data Types
description: Learn how to store and manipulate data using variables

content.introduction:
Variables are containers for storing data. Think of them as labeled boxes where you can put different types of information.

In this lesson, you'll learn how to create variables, assign values to them, and use them in your programs.

### What You'll Learn
- Declaring variables
- Basic data types (Integer, String, Real, Boolean)
- Assigning values to variables
- Using variables in output

concepts.title: Variable Declaration
concepts.description: Variables must be declared in the 'var' section before the 'begin' block, specifying their name and type

concepts.title: Data Types
concepts.description: DWScript has several basic types: Integer (whole numbers), Real (decimals), String (text), Boolean (true/false)

concepts.title: Assignment
concepts.description: Use the := operator to assign a value to a variable

examples.title: Integer Variables
examples.description: Store whole numbers using the Integer type

examples.title: String Variables
examples.description: Store text using the String type

examples.title: Multiple Types
examples.description: Use different types of variables together
examples.expectedOutput:
Name: Bob
Age: 20
Height: 1.75m
Student: True

exercises.title: Personal Profile
exercises.description: Create a program that stores and displays your personal information using variables: name, age, favorite color, and favorite number.
hints: Declare each variable with its appropriate type in the 'var' section
Use WriteLn with the variable name (no quotes)

exercises.title: Simple Calculator
exercises.description: Create variables for two numbers and calculate their sum, displaying the result.
hints: You need at least 3 integer variables
You can declare multiple variables of the same type on one line
Use the + operator to add numbers
Store the result in a variable before displaying it

content.summary:
Great work! You've learned:

- How to declare variables in the `var` section
- Basic data types: Integer, String, Real, Boolean
- Assigning values using `:=`
- Using variables in output with `WriteLn`
- Combining variables and text

Variables are fundamental to programming - they allow your programs to store and manipulate data!
content.nextSteps: Next, you'll learn about **operators and expressions** to perform calculations and manipulate your variables in more complex ways.
